Interface ISound

  • All Superinterfaces:

extends java.io.Serializable, IStreamingMedia

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start()
    throws java.io.IOException
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while attempting to set up a stream from the audio source file to the audio hardware.
        See Also:
        start(int)

      • start

        void start(int loops)
    throws java.io.IOException
        Starts playing the sound.
        Parameters:
        loops - The number of times the sound should play. Use -1 for infinite looping.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If an I/O error occurs while attempting to set up a stream from the audio source file to the audio hardware.

      • stop

        void stop()
        Description copied from interface: IStreamingMedia
        Stops playback.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface IStreamingMedia
        See Also:
        stop(int)

      • stop

        void stop(int fadeOutMillis)
        Stops playing the sound.
        Parameters:
        fadeOutMillis - Instead of stopping the sound immediately, fade it out slowly over the course of fadeOutMillis.

      • getFilename

        nl.weeaboo.filesystem.FilePath getFilename()
        Returns:
        The path of the audio source file.

      • getSoundType

        SoundType getSoundType()
        Returns:
        The SoundType for this sound (music, sound effect, voice clip).

      • getLoopsLeft

        int getLoopsLeft()
        Returns:
        The number of playback loops remaining, or -1 when looping infinitely.
        See Also:
        start(int)

      • getPrivateVolume

        double getPrivateVolume()
        Returns the private volume.
        See Also:
        setPrivateVolume(double)

      • getMasterVolume

        double getMasterVolume()
        Returns the master volume.
        See Also:
        setMasterVolume(double)

      • getVolume

        double getVolume()
        Returns the final volume used for audio playback. The final volume is determined by multiplying the private and master volume values together.

      • setPrivateVolume

        void setPrivateVolume(double v)
        Set the private volume. This is the volume setting intended for use by scripts.
        See Also:
        getVolume()

      • setMasterVolume

        void setMasterVolume(double v)
        Sets the master volume. This is the volume setting controlled by user preferences.
        See Also:
        getVolume()

      • setPreferredChannel

        void setPreferredChannel(int ch)
        Sets the audio channel used to play this sound.
        See Also:
        ISoundController.set(int, ISound)
